companyDescription:
We want to help you do what you do best. At CBI Health, our extensive national network is here to help you increase your local impact. By joining our care team, you’ll receive the independence and experienced support structure you need to provide life-changing care for your clients and their families. And while you do that, our team of over 13,000 healthcare professionals has your back!

For millions of Canadians, CBI Health is where better begins. We are Canada’s leading community healthcare provider, reliably delivering innovative Rehabilitation and Home Health care programs that help our clients achieve their health goals. With 250+ locations in more than 800 communities, people are at the heart of what we do. Every day, all across the country, our team members work together to make a meaningful difference in our clients’ lives and help shape healthcare for the better. 
Learn more about CBI Health.

Company Mission/Culture
People are at the heart of what we do. Together, we serve local clients and communities by delivering nationally supported Rehabilitation and Home Health services. We also serve every member of our team by helping them achieve their health career goals through meaningful work and impactful outcomes.

Our Purpose, Promise, and Values are what inform and guide this mission. These essential elements are at the heart of the decisions we make, the programs we implement, and the strategies we develop. Across the country, the CBI Health team is committed to delivering on Our Purpose, keeping Our Promise, and living Our Values in every community we serve.

Our Purpose: The health and well-being of Canadians is at the heart of what we do. Every day, we make a meaningful difference in people’s lives by supporting them in achieving their goals. Together, we shape healthcare for the better. 

Our Promise: For our clients, we promise to always:  
Treat you with dignity, respect and kindness 
Understand you, your goals and what matters most 
Engage, motivate, and inspire you on your health journey 
Bring together our knowledge, expertise and experience to deliver the best care 
Earn and appreciate the trust you place in us 

Our Values:
Heart – We are passionate about making a positive difference 
Respect – We accept and value everyone 
Reliability – We do what we say we will do 
Teamwork – We work well together and support each other 
Innovation – We are committed to learning, improving and growing.
 
Learn more about the CBI Health culture.

Diversity Programs and Initiatives: CBI Health continually strives to be an inclusive organization and create a respectful work environment where everyone feels included and valued. Diversity in our workplace allows us to share and implement different perspectives, which we believe inevitably leads to better internal and external outcomes. Accepting and valuing everyone, part of Our Values, ensures that the CBI Health culture is strong, enhances the well-being of all team members, and allows us to effectively work together to fulfill Our Purpose: shaping healthcare for the better. 

Our employee-led Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) Committee is now in its third year running and continues to make great progress in developing meaningful initiatives to help team members feel safe and accepted as their authentic selves. Creating impactful new DEI initiatives and enhancing existing initiatives will remain a CBI Health priority moving forward.

Awards: CBI Health is proud to be a national leader in the field of community healthcare. We are regularly recognized for our exemplary Rehabilitation and Home Health expertise, as well as our commitment to industry-recognized organizational best practices.
description:
Personal Support Worker, Ottawa 
  What we can offer you: 
  
  Competitive wage between $21.85 - $23.99 in total compensation for direct care including travel pay 
  Full Time & Part Time Opportunities 
  Weekend and Evening Shift Premiums 
  Mileage Pay or Bus Pass reimbursement 
  Comprehensive benefits package 
  Paid orientation and ongoing training 
  Career Development and progression opportunities 
  Employee Assistance Program 
  Access to all necessary Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) 
  Flexible schedule and work arrangements 
  
 
  Check with your recruiter on eligibility criteria to qualify for this bonus
  
  Do your life’s best work with us! 
  CBI Health is dedicated to improving the lives of both our clients and our healthcare team members. As you care for others, CBI Health will care for you by providing the Personal Protective Equipment, training and resources that you need to feel confident every day. 
  We’re committed to making a difference in people’s lives – and that starts with yours. You’ll enjoy a flexible schedule that allows you to achieve your goals at work and at home, with a balance of teamwork and independence. We have a team of Supervisors and motivated colleagues who are excited to meet and support you! 
  Your role with clients As a caring, responsible health care team member, you will support clients to be as safe and independent in their homes as possible, helping them to live their best lives. You will provide personal care to clients in their home, and may assist them to mobilize and perform light exercises. You will act at all times with the client and their family at the heart of all you do, observing, documenting, and reporting any changes in their condition to your Manager/Supervisor. You may be required to perform light housekeeping tasks as indicated in client care plans. 
  What you will need to be successful 
  
  Your Personal Support Worker Certificate, or valid certification as a Home Support Worker, Home Support worker level II, Home Support worker level III, Health Care aid or personal attendant will be considered an asset 
  Students currently enrolled (post first year) in health care programs such as nursing, rehab, para medicine or have a valid certificate as a Developmental Support Worker or a valid certificate as an RN , RPN, or Practical Nurse, midwife or physician ( either domestic or internationally –trained ) or RN students with a minimum successful completion of year 1 
  Current CPR and First Aid Certification 
  A clear Criminal Record Check with Vulnerable Sector Screening within the last 12 months 
  Proof of a negative TB test within the last 12 months and an up-to-date immunization record 
  Ability to travel from home to home within the Ottawa community 
  Commitment to work every other weekend 
  Strong verbal and written English communication skills required; the ability to communicate in French or other languages is considered an asset 
  Reliability and strong organization skills 
  Ability to safely lift up to 35 lbs. (16 kg) 
  
 About CBI Health 
  If you are passionate about offering a person-centered approach to care, this is your chance to do what you do best. Our interdisciplinary team enables you to collaborate with a variety of experts, explore your interests and achieve amazing results. We have more than 12,000 professionals working together to set the bar for best practices in the industry. For almost 50 years, we’ve flourished as an integrated network with a talented team of professionals just like you. Every day, we come together to help our clients and families live their best lives and achieve their personal goals and priorities – it all starts with you. 
  Join us at CBI Health - Because Your Care Matters 
  
  CBI Health is committed to providing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels safe and accepted as their authentic selves. We actively seek qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion and contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives that help us innovate and provide the best possible care to our clients. 
  We are committed to fostering a positive experience for all Indigenous applicants whether you’re First Nations (status or non-status), Inuit or Metis and welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristics that make each of us different. 
  In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and CBI Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of our hiring process. Please inform your recruiter if you have any accommodation requests. 
   #HHEAST 
   #HHEAST
